TopicTitle: [1.4.x - 1.7.x] Nehemia Engineering Orbital Science Mods (NEOS - Micha's build) (0.8.1)

Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> Just now, Sudragon said:
> 
> 
> Is there the option to get reputation rather than science? Doing (for example) 'live radio interview of a kerbonaut...in orbit!' (needs kerbonaut and open comms band (link to <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr>)?
> 

There isn't, but that's an interesting idea. I guess this could easily be done with a [Contract Configrator](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/91625-contract-configurator)config and wouldn't need to be tied to any specific mod as it wouldn't actually require any experiments or specific parts to do.
The POSA/PPMD/ETC bug seems to be back with 1.2.1. If it's another mod, could someone supply information?

> 
> 
> On 05/11/2016 at 0:39 AM, Sudragon said:
> 
> 
> The POSA/PPMD/ETC bug seems to be back with 1.2.1. If it's another mod, could someone supply information?
> 

Exactly which bug do you mean - not completing missions? Also, what, if any, mods do you have installed (other than <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr>/<abbr title="Kerbal Inventory System (mod)">KIS</abbr>)? Finally - logfile?

Well so far so good. Right now the only *potential bug* that I can see is no contracts appearing in the ALL tab of Contract Configure. However still not convinced it is a real bug because of other things are going on in my game right now. If I get time I do a test without any other mods. Just this and Contract Configure installed. If it does turn out to be a real problem then I post link to the logs as well. 

The main thing is it seems to be working so far in career mode. Still have lots of bits to check but I am really enjoying this so far. Honestly without this mod and Station Science. I would start to loose interest pretty quickly in KSP in general. Thank you so much.

The POSA goes, the POSA comes down, loaded in a MOLE Appaloosa module. The mission recognises that the research has been done, but not the return.  
  
[https://www.dropbox.com/s/00wopjfzoucjhfd/output_log 2DEC2016.txt?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/00wopjfzoucjhfd/output_log%202DEC2016.txt?dl=0)

Based on GitHub, yours appears to be the most up to date "unofficial" maintenance version.  So, I've forked it and I intend to add configs for Trails and BDB both of which have Gemini capsules like Tantares, hgr, etc.  I'll do a pull request when I'm done.

I'm using this with KSP 1.2.2, module manager 2.7.5. I've launched the MSL-600 to low kerbin orbit, I have a scientist in it, I've installed some equipment (ultrasound and glovebox I believe), I have a ship docked with the CCF experiment, appropriate for the 600 and installed equipment, but I never see the "Install CCF" button. I can only move it, and only to the empty slots of the OMS ESC 3 capsule.

Am I missing something that's changed?

Hi guys and gals,

Apologies for the long silence; my personal life has become very busy of late and I haven't had much time to spend on gaming, let alone KSP.  Glad to hear that mostly OMS seems to be ticking along. I was most of the way through a major revamp when I had to park everything.

Just tried to take a look at your issue [@viveleroi](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/168394-viveleroi/) and it appears that my SSD has packed it in - which contained all my work-in-progress on KSP/OMS. Grr. Currently attempting data recovery, but it's not looking good I'm afraid.  
  
[@tg626](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/112361-tg626/): Looking forward to your pull request ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

**Edited <time datetime="2017-05-06T19:49:40Z" title="05/06/2017 07:49  PM" data-short="7 yr">May 6, 2017</time> by micha**

So, as an update, I did find my old spinny-disk (which had since been reformatted but, luckily, not actually used) and have managed to recover the lvm on it. Unfortunately it really is old - Jul2016 - which means that my work-in-progress really is gone apart from what's up on GitHub. But no matter, at least I have my dev environment back!

I've launched the MSL-600 to low kerbin orbit, I have a scientist in it, I've installed some equipment (ultrasound and glovebox I believe), I have a ship docked with the CCF experiment, appropriate for the 600 and installed equipment, but I never see the "Install CCF" button. I can only move it, and only to the empty slots of the OMS ESC 3 capsule.
>

Hmm, "works for me". 

Could you please double check:

- The station has an "MPL-600", not the "MSL-1000".
- You've installed the "MSG" (Micro-gravity Science Glovebox) equipment
- The Glovebox equipment is currently empty; that is, there's no experiment currently installed in the MSG.
Made an early release for **KSP 1.3**, top-post for links/changes.

If anybody wants to do some pre-alpha testing, I've just pushed a rebuilt binary and 'GameData' to the repository into its own branch:

[https://github.com/mwerle/OrbitalMaterialScience/tree/mw_feature_new_ui](https://github.com/mwerle/OrbitalMaterialScience/tree/mw_feature_new_ui)

Contains a new GUI and localisation support. It's still WIP but any early feedback and additional localisation is welcome, although be aware that the dictionaries will probably still change a little.

**NB:** I've temporarily put the german translation into the english dictionaries in order to test the localisation. To just test the new GUI, swap the english and german dictionaries around!

Just did a quick test - nothing more than KSP loading up with this plus 90+ mods and no errors in either log. Took a KEES out for a quick EVA and no issues attaching that to a pod and opening the experiment. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

Another pre-alpha test release; hopefully finally fixes KEES experiment contract returns!

Also more tweaks to localisation.

Download the "Gamedata" folder from here if you want to give it a try:

[https://github.com/mwerle/OrbitalMaterialScience/tree/mw_feature_new_ui](https://github.com/mwerle/OrbitalMaterialScience/tree/mw_feature_new_ui)
Thanks for keeping this alive [@micha](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/113840-micha/)

Tried the pre alpha, now it's all German to me...I think Verner has been messing with something.

Swap the dictionaries...hmmm

There's also a typo in one of the KEES experiment result text blocks. There's a 'geneni' instead of a 'gemini'

[@micha](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/113840-micha/) hey, I've made a PR with Kemini compatibility for Bluedog Design Bureau. Is there any particular reason that more advanced pods don't have support? I assume the experiments would have been run dry at that point but still... ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

[@CobaltWolf](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/105588-cobaltwolf/) Yeah, the Kemini experiments were conceived for the early game and early pods. It's trivial for anybody who wants them to be on every pod to just add a <abbr title="Module Manager (mod)">MM</abbr> config that does that ("Kemini-For-All" ?).

Thanks for the PR, I've merged it in (but no ETA yet for next release, sorry).
